record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 3, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 3, 2007 -- (Senate - October 02, 2007)

[Page: S12451]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, October 3; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two sides, with the majority controlling the first half and the Republicans controlling the final portion; that following morning business, the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 3222, as provided for under a previous order, and that the mandatory quorum be waived as required under rule XXII.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
